basics.name: Ryan Copley
basics.label: Senior Software Developer
basics.summary: Cincinnati raised software developer since age 14 with a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science from Bowling Green State University. Proven iOS developer with a large showcase of iOS applications. Extensive knowledge of the iOS SDK, as well as many backend languages. Web developer & code reviewer of USA Today, a Django based website. Lover of ECMAScript 6, a great UX, and fun projects. I read ARM assembly for fun.

work.summary: Senior developer & code reviewer of the USA Today desktop platform. We utilized Scalr, TeamCity, and Chef for all devops projects, including an auto-scaling webservice. If there was a sudden surge in resource utilization, using the scaling rules we defined, new application servers would come online and go offline as load fluctuates. Utilizing multiple AWS regions, automatic failover was enabled in case of outages. Helped migrate our team from SVN to git, including training and assisting others.

Developed BGSU branded applications for various departments under the supervision of Dr. Joseph Chao. Worked with a small team of 4 mobile developers (2 iOS, 2 Android). Built 3 applications from the ground up to App Store.
Developed & maintained enterprise finance software that consumed receipts and bills from various vendors to track resource allocation, project cost, and unused services.

Developed a file hosting website for a community that ended up growing out of control, tens of thousands of registered and verifed user accounts, terabytes of files uploaded, and an average sustained network usage of 400 mbps.
